text: we've just witnessed the birth of the
world's newest nation the Republic of
South Sudan the 54th country and Africa
after decades of gorillas struggle and
intense international pressure this part
of Sudan has declared its independence
from the north the celebration started
at midnight last night and by dawn this
morning there were thousands of people
thronging into the streets marching to
this location they were banging drums
singing songs waving flags it was a real
out born of jubilation a lot of people
talked about the sacrifices that had
been made we heard in the speeches from
Salva Kiir that the people of South
Sudan will forgive but they will never
forget congratulations the liberation
struggle started in the 1950s it
resulted in decades of guerrilla warfare
two million people were killed and those
martyrs and the people who died were
very much on the mind of the people who
were celebrating here today the
ceremonies ended much in the way this
independence struggle began with very
loud cannon shots this was an
Independence earned by war many people
have died and that sacrifice was not far
from any of our minds this is Jeffrey
gentlemen in Juba the capital of the
world's newest country the Republic of
South Sudan
listen
